conclusion: The initial distance from the piston to the bottom of the cylinder is L1 = 19 cm.
The mass of the cylinder is M = 4.5 kg.
The mass of the piston is m = 3 kg.
The area of the piston is S = 30 cm^2.
The atmospheric pressure is p0 = 1.0 x 10^5 Pa.
The maximum tension the rope can withstand is F = 120 N.
The gravitational acceleration is g = 10 m/s^2.
The maximum distance that the piston can reach from the bottom of the cylinder when the elevator moves along the vertical direction is L2.
Calculate the total weight of the cylinder and piston: W = (M + m)g = (4.5 + 3) x 10 = 75 N.
Calculate the maximum tension the rope can withstand: F = 120 N.
Calculate the maximum upward force that can be applied to the piston: Fmax = F - W = 120 - 75 = 45 N.
Calculate the maximum pressure that can be applied to the piston: pmax = Fmax / S = 45 / 30 = 1.5 Pa.
Calculate the maximum distance that the piston can reach from the bottom of the cylinder: L2 = L1 + (pmax / p0) x S = 19 + (1.5 / 1.0 x 10^5) x 30 = 19 + 0.000045 x 30 = 19.00135 cm.
The maximum distance that the piston can reach from the bottom of the cylinder when the elevator moves along the vertical direction is approximately 19.00135 cm.
